intro: Gnidia kasaiensis, commonly known as the Kasai kniphofia, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are cylindrical and somewhat woody. Gnidia kasaiensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
